 <https://mail.acb.com.vn/owa/auth/acb/footer-emai.png> 

Email chứa thông tin dành riêng cho người nhận, có thể là thông tin mật. Nếu bạn không phải là người nhận mong muốn, bạn không nên xem, sử dụng, phổ biến, phân phối, sao chép email hoặc tập tin đính kèm theo email này. Bạn nên xóa nội dung này và thông báo cho người gửi. ACB chịu trách nhiệm về các chuẩn mực chất lượng dịch vụ, thông tin sản phẩm dịch vụ và quy tắc ứng xử được công bố. Ngoài các nội dung nêu trên, email này có thể chứa các quan điểm cá nhân và ý kiến của người gửi hoặc tác giả, không phải là quan điểm và ý kiến của ACB hoặc các công ty trực thuộc. Do đó, ACB không chịu trách nhiệm đối với bất kỳ khiếu nại, tổn thất hoặc thiệt hại nào phát sinh liên quan đến email này. Để biết thêm thông tin chi tiết, tham khảo tại website ACB.

subject: UOBV - FX Forward Indication - 25 Aug 25
body:
[This email is from an EXTERNAL source. Please use caution when opening attachments, clicking links, or responding]


Dear Anh/Chị,

					
								
Please kindly find our indicative rate as below:

					
								
Indicative rate as at 25-Aug-25 9:22 AM

					
Tenor (month)

Trade Date

1.80%

40

26,355

2M

25-Aug-25

27-Oct-25

63

1.80%

82

26,397

3M

25-Aug-25

25-Nov-25

92

26,315

1.90%

126

26,441

4M

25-Aug-25

26-Dec-25

123

26,315

1.90%

168

26,483

5M

25-Aug-25

26-Jan-26

154

26,315

2.00%

222

26,537

								
(*) FX Forward is tradable up to 5M. Rate subject to market movement at all the time.

 

Market Snapshot:

 

 

*	At the Jackson Hole Symposium last Fri (22 Aug), the key takeaway for the markets from FOMC Chair Jerome Powell’s speech was that the Fed chief opened the door to a possible Sep FOMC rate cut. Powell shifted the balance for his outlook from inflation towards the labor market even as he acknowledged the risks of tariffs to the uncertain path for inflation. Powell noted “Our policy rate is now 100 basis points closer to neutral than it was a year ago, and the stability of the unemployment rate and other labor market measures allows us to proceed carefully as we consider changes to our policy stance. Nonetheless, with policy in restrictive territory, the baseline outlook and the shifting balance of risks may warrant adjusting our policy stance.”
*	US tariff and fiscal news: The 50% tariffs on Indian exports to US is set to take effect this Wed (27 Aug) while the US is also set to end the "de minimis" tariff exemption (which had allowed low value imports to enter US duty-free) on Fri (29 Aug), putting upside price pressures on American households in the near term. 
*	The US dollar was weaker against all G10 FX on Fri (22 Aug) with the Scandinavian currencies gaining the most after Chair Powell’s speech at Jackson Hole opened the door to a Sep Fed rate cut. The US Dollar index (DXY) ended lower by -0.92% to 97.716 (from the previous session’s close of 98.619).
*	SBV set the central rate at 25,291 on Monday (-7d). Official trading band is in range 24,027-26,555 (+3.93YTD). Last Friday, SBV announced intervention policy effective on 25 & 26 Aug 2025. To sell FX forward contract (cancellable before maturity date) with tenor 180-day at 26,550. SBV will sell USD to banks with negative foreign exchange positions and a genuine need to buy USD. USD/VND Spot drop sharply by 100d from 25,450 level to 26,350 level on Friday after SBV action to support the VND.

(Source: UOB Market Overview - 25 Aug <https://www.uobgroup.com/assets/web-resources/research/pdf/MO_250825.pdf> )

 

Nguyen Nhat Anh (Ms.)

Vice President - Global Market



Central Plaza, 15th Floor, 17 Le Duan Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

Tel (84) 28 7300 4713         Email Nguyen.NhatAn1@uobgroup.com <mailto:Nguyen.NhatAn1@uobgroup.com>  | vngmsales@uobgroup.com <mailto:vngmsales@uobgroup.com> 



 

 

 


## RESTRICTED ##


UOB EMAIL DISCLAIMER: Any person receiving this email and any attachment(s) contained, shall treat the information as confidential and not misuse, copy, disclose, distribute or retain the information in any way that amounts to a breach of confidentiality. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete all copies of this email from your computer system. Any opinion in this email may not necessarily represent the opinion of UOB or any entity in the UOB Group.
